subject: Technology
title: Microchip Implants: Cyborgs Among Us
description: Learn Microchip Implants: Cyborgs Among Us in one minute.

hook.text: Thousands of people have voluntarily implanted microchips in their hands to unlock doors, pay for coffee, and store data.

buildup.text: The chips are about the size of a grain of rice and use NFC technology, the same as contactless credit cards.

discovery.text: In Sweden, thousands of commuters use hand implants instead of train tickets. A wave of the hand opens the gate.

twist.text: Unlike a card, you can't leave a chip at home, lose it, or have it stolen. But you also can't easily remove or update it.

climax.text: As implant technology advances, the line between human and machine grows blurrier. We're already becoming cyborgs by choice.

punchline.text: The first cyborgs aren't science fiction characters. They're Swedish commuters.

quiz.question: What technology do most human microchip implants use?
options: NFC, the same as contactless credit cards
